content:
Major improvements:
  • support for Bootstrap 2.2.2
  • added HTML5 inputs: email, url, tel, number, range
  • removed default dataType=json. If you are using json please set ajaxOptions config.
  • submit method refactored. See changelog for details.
  • some other fixes

New version contains some incompatible changes!
Please, look through changelog before updating.
Major improvements are:
  • render event was replaced with display callback. It gives more flexibility to display value, even into another element
  • all callback's scope was changed to element. Check your validate, success and etc methods for using this keyword
  • $.fn.editableform.types replaced with $.fn.editabletypes. It allows including inputs before editableform is loaded. Also $.fn.editableform.utils replaced with $.fn.editableutils
  • hidden event now has reason parameter allowing smart focusing between editable elements. See updated demo
  • many other fixes
Thanks for your feedback and support!

• activate editable by dblclick
  • hide buttons via new option
  • write your own inputs (see address in demo)
  • and some other changes

Major improvements of new version:
  • Added new input type checklist. Try it in demo
  • In date widgets appeared 'clear' button to reset date
  • CSS was refactored to ensure IE7+ support
  • Form template was a bit changed. If you use overwritten template in your projects please refer to global templates section before update
Many thanks to community for support!
Full list of changes here.

Initial release of X-editable. This library is new life of bootstrap-editable plugin (1.1.4) that was strongly refactored and improved. Main reasons caused re-branding and creation of new project are:
  • support not only bootstrap but any core library: bootstrap, jquery-ui or pure jquery
  • different container classes to show form:
    popover, tooltip, poshytip
  • inline and popup modes
  • new directory structure and logic in separate js files allowing easy extending
Please see changelog for upgrade instructions.
